Falters at times: The claim falters at times because it relies on misquoted statistics and uses misleading information.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it is based on limited data and reports that may not provide an accurate representation of the average age of minimum wage workers.
Problematic assumption: The claim makes the problematic assumption that the average age of minimum wage workers is 35 without considering other factors or alternative explanations.
Exist alternative explanation: There may be alternative explanations for the average age of minimum wage workers, such as the availability of higher-paying jobs or the impact of economic factors, which are not explored in the claim.
